value.title: Getting Started with Power BI
value.excerpt: These videos will help you with getting started with Power BI. From Power BI Desktop to the Power BI service and items in between, this is a great way to get started.

topItems.title: What is Power BI?
topItems.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at what is Power BI. While people may see bits and pieces of Power BI, they may not understand holistically what Power BI is. From Power BI Desktop to the Power BI service and the mobile app, Power BI is a full suite of tools for your visualization and reporting needs.  Power

value.title: Get started with Microsoft data analytics
value.excerpt: Businesses need data analysis more than ever. In this learning path, you will learn about the life and journey of a data analyst, the skills, tasks, and processes they go through in order to tell a story with data so trusted business decisions can be made. You will learn how the suite of Power BI tools and services are used by a data analyst to tell a compelling story through reports and dashboards, and the need to true BI in the enterprise.

topItems.title: Discover data analysis
topItems.excerpt: Would you like to explore the journey of a data analyst and learn how a data analyst tells a story with data? In this module, you will explore the different roles in data and learn the different tasks of a data analyst.

topItems.title: Get started building with Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power BI is a collection of software services and applications that let you connect to all sorts of data sources and create compelling visuals and reports. You can benefit from receiving those reports, or you can share them with others inside or outside your organization. Learn the basics of Power BI, how its services and applications work together, and how they can be used to create or experience compelling visuals and analytics based on your data.

value.title: Discover data analysis
value.excerpt: Would you like to explore the journey of a data analyst and learn how a data analyst tells a story with data? In this module, you will explore the different roles in data and learn the different tasks of a data analyst.

value.title: Create and use analytics reports with Power BI
value.excerpt: This learning path introduces you to Power BI, and teaches you to use and build business intelligence reports.

topItems.title: Get started building with Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power BI is a collection of software services and applications that let you connect to all sorts of data sources and create compelling visuals and reports. You can benefit from receiving those reports, or you can share them with others inside or outside your organization. Learn the basics of Power BI, how its services and applications work together, and how they can be used to create or experience compelling visuals and analytics based on your data.

topItems.title: Get data with Power BI Desktop
topItems.excerpt: How can you find, collect, and clean data from different sources? Power BI is a tool for making sense of your data. You will learn tricks to make data-gathering easier.

topItems.title: Model data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Connect Power BI to multiple data sources to create reports. Define the relationship between your data sources.

topItems.title: Use visuals in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Create and customize visuals to present data in compelling and insightful ways.

value.title: What is Power BI?
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at what is Power BI. While people may see bits and pieces of Power BI, they may not understand holistically what Power BI is. From Power BI Desktop to the Power BI service and the mobile app, Power BI is a full suite of tools for your visualization and reporting needs.  Power

value.title: Prepare data for analysis
value.excerpt: Students will explore Power Query as they learn to extract data from different data sources and choose a storage mode and connectivity type. They will learn to profile, clean, and load data into Power BI in preparation for modeling their data.

topItems.title: Get data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

topItems.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that you‚Äôre seeking for deeper analytics.

You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that you‚Äôre seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: DAX Fridays by Curbal
value.excerpt: Are you new to DAX or are you having problems with a specific DAX function? In this playlist, I cover a new DAX function every friday, so you and I can learn DAX in depth.

topItems.title: DAX Fridays! #1: How to write DAX measures....fast in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: DAX Fridays! #1: How to write DAX measures....fast in Power BI  In today's video I will show you how to write Power BI measures quickly and even how to format them.  PREVIOUS VIDEO: - NEXT VIDEO: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kC3w_KVVabY   Looking for a download file? Go to our Download Center: https://curbal.com/donwload-center
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pabn7kLxN6c" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: DAX Fridays! #2: CALENDAR, CALENDARAUTO
topItems.excerpt: Create a calendar with DAX in Power BI. Generate/ Create calendars in DAX using CALENDAR() and/or CALENDARAUTO().  Video keynotes: 01:02 Calendarauto function 03:02 Calendar function  Link to Power BI file and Curbal Glossary: https://curbal.com/blog/create-power-bi-custom-calendars  PREVIOUS VIDEO:
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/kC3w_KVVabY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: DAX Fridays! #3: SUM and SUMX
topItems.excerpt: Dax Fridays! Today we will go through: how to use SUM() and SUMX(), the difference between them and when should we use one vs the other.  The DAX SUM function calculates the sum of all numbers in a column while the DAX SUMX function returns the sum of an expression for each row in a table.  02:28 Create
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vcYz0XPklXg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: DAX Fridays! #4: COUNT, COUNTA, COUNTX, COUNTAX, DISTINCTCOUNT AND COUNTROWS in DAX
topItems.excerpt: Let's go through all the count expressions available in DAX!  Here you have the keynotes for the video so you can jump to the function you want to learn:  02:44 COUNT text (#ERROR) 03:24 COUNT numbers 04:20 COUNT blanks 04:56 COUNT dates 05:36 COUNTA text 06:44 COUNTA numbers 07:27 COUNTX 09:16 COUNTAX
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/V8wYTjKyvgk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
